title.narrative: North Macedonia Emergency COVID-19 Response Project

description.narrative: The purpose of the Emergency COVID-19 Response Project in North Macedonia is to prevent, detect and respond to the threat posed by COVID-19 (Coronavirus) and strengthen national systems for public health preparedness. This project has three components. Component one will provide immediate support to help the Republic of North Macedonia limit the local transmission of COVID-19 (Coronavirus) through containment strategies. There are three subcomponents: (i) Enhancing case detection, confirmation, contact tracing, reporting, and monitoring; (ii) Strengthening the borrower's health system, and; (iii) Financing of Health Insurance Premia for Vulnerable Beneficiaries. Component two will finance temporary income support to eligible individuals and households to enable them to comply with the social distancing measures the Government has introduced to contain the COVID-19 pandemic. There are two subcomponents: (i) Temporary social assistance support, and; (ii) Temporary unemployment insurance support. Component three will support the administrative and human resources needed to implement the project and monitor and evaluate progress.
